full_summary:
### Tender Notice: Log Lifter Refurbishment - Trent-Severn Waterway National Historic Site
#### Solicitation Number: 5P300-23-0051/A

**Procurement Overview:**
Parks Canada is seeking a contractor to refurbish and rebuild four log lifters at the Trent-Severn Waterway National Historic Site. 

**Tender Schedule:**

* **Tender Closing Date:** August 16, 2023, 14:00 EST
* **Expected Contract Start Date:** August 21, 2023
* **Expected Contract End Date:** March 31, 2024

**Scope of Work:**
The contractor will disassemble, sandblast, and inspect metal components, and perform any necessary repairs. The work will be done in accordance with NationalPark Act regulations. 

**Eligibility:**
The following trade agreements apply to this procurement: World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), and others.

**Submission Requirements:**

* Bids received by fax and email will be accepted as official.
* Bids submitted via SAP Ariba are not accepted.
* Bids received in person or by courier will not be accepted.
* The only accepted email address for responses to the bid solicitation is [soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca](mailto:soumissionsest-bidseast@pc.gc.ca). Bids submitted by email directly to the Contracting Authority or to any email address other than this will not be accepted. 
* The only acceptable fax number for responses to bid solicitations is 1-877-558-2349.

**Contact Information:**
For more information, please contact Nicholas Moïse, Contracting Authority, at 343-585-4589 or nicholas.moise@pc.gc.ca.

**Attachment:**
Please refer to the attached documents on the Canada eApps platform for further details regarding this procurement.

**Technologies Used/Operations:**
The buyer used a markdown translator, as the original input document was not in markdown format. "gdoc" was used as the input format, with default choices set. To write a better markdown-formatted entry with
distinctive ascriptive formatting via section/blockquotes, This is the rendered markdown code above.

In the output file use the Haskell standard where applicable and the Haskell Markdown (http://www.sakileshamumbai.in/rem tajdv
